levelledPara.title: NAME
levelledPara.para: s1kd-icncatalog - Manage the catalog used to resolve ICNs

levelledPara.title: DESCRIPTION
levelledPara.para: The s1kd-icncatalog tool is used to manage a catalog of ICNs for a project, and to resolve ICNs using this catalog. Resolving an ICN means placing the actual filename of the ICN in to the SYSTEM ID of the ENTITY declaration within CSDB objects.

levelledPara.title: OPTIONS

listItemDefinition.para: Add an ICN to the catalog. Follow with the -u and -n options to specify the URI and notation to use for this ICN. The -m option specifies a media group to add the ICN to.

Specify the catalog file to manage or resolve against. By default, the file .icncatalog in the current directory is used. If the current directory does not contain this file, the parent directories will be searched.
Delete an ICN from the catalog. The -m option specifies a media group to delete the ICN from.
Overwrite the input CSDB objects when resolving ICNs, or overwrite the catalog file when modifying it. Otherwise, output is written to stdout.
Treat input (stdin or arguments) as lists of filenames of CSDB objects, rather than CSDB objects themselves.
Resolve ICNs for this intended output media. The catalog may contain alternative formats for the same ICN to be used for different output media.
Specify the notation to reference when adding an ICN with the -a option.
Specify the URI when adding an ICN with the -a option.

levelledPara.para: In addition, the following options enable features of the XML parser that are disabled as a precaution by default:

listItemDefinition.para: Allow network access to load external DTD and entities.

levelledPara.title: Resolving ICNs to filenames
levelledPara.para: A CSDB object may reference an ICN as follows:

para.verbatimText: <!NOTATION png SYSTEM "png"> <!ENTITY ICN-12345-00001-001-01 SYSTEM "ICN-12345-00001-001-01.PNG" NDATA png>

levelledPara.para: The SYSTEM ID of this ENTITY indicates that the ICN file will be in the same directory relative to the CSDB object. However, the ICN files in this example are located in a separate folder called 'graphics'. Rather than manually updating every ENTITY declaration in every CSDB object, a catalog file can be used to map ICNs to actual filenames:
Then, using this tool, the ICN can be resolved against the catalog:

para.verbatimText: <!NOTATION png SYSTEM "png"> <!ENTITY ICN-12345-00001-001-01 SYSTEM "graphics/ICN-12345-00001-001-01.PNG" NDATA png>

levelledPara.title: Alternative ICN formats
levelledPara.para: A catalog can also be used to provide alternative file formats for an ICN depending on the intended output media. For example:

para.verbatimText: <icnCatalog> <notation name="jpg" systemId="jpg"/> <notation name="svg" systemId="svg"/> <media name="pdf"> <icn infoEntityIdent="ICN-12345-00001-001-01" uri="ICN-12345-00001-001-01.JPG" notation="jpg"/> </media> <media name="web"> <icn infoEntityIdent="ICN-12345-00001-001-01" uri="ICN-12345-00001-001-01.SVG" notation="svg"/> </media> </icnCatalog>

levelledPara.para: The -m option allows for specifying which type of media to resolve for:

para.verbatimText: <!NOTATION png SYSTEM "png"> <!ENTITY ICN-12345-00001-001-01 SYSTEM "ICN-12345-00001-001-01.PNG" NDATA png>
<!NOTATION png SYSTEM "png"> <!NOTATION jpg SYSTEM "jpg"> <!ENTITY ICN-12345-00001-001-01 SYSTEM "ICN-12345-00001-001-01.JPG" NDATA jpg>
<!NOTATION png SYSTEM "png"> <!NOTATION svg SYSTEM "svg"> <!ENTITY ICN-12345-00001-001-01 SYSTEM "ICN-12345-00001-001-01.SVG" NDATA svg>

levelledPara.title: Reconstructing ICN entity declarations
levelledPara.para: Some processing, such as XSL transformations, may remove the DTD and external entity declarations as part of parsing an XML CSDB object. A catalog can be used to restore the necessary external entity declarations afterwards. For example:
The resulting XML will not include a DTD or the external entity declarations for the ICNs referenced in the object, so it will not be valid according to the S1000D schema:

para.verbatimText: $ xsltproc ex.xsl <object> | s1kd-validate -:49:element graphic: Schemas validity error: Element 'graphic', attribute 'infoEntityIdent': 'ICN-12345-00001-001-01' is not a valid value of the atomic type 'xs:ENTITY'.

levelledPara.para: Passing the result to this tool, with a catalog containing all the ICNs used by the project:
will reconstruct the required external entity declarations in the DTD.

note.notePara: The s1kd-tools will copy the DTD and external entity declarations automatically when performing transformations (such as with the s1kd-transform tool), so this is only necessary when using more generic XML tools.

levelledPara.title: CATALOG SCHEMA
levelledPara.para: The following describes the schema of an ICN catalog file.

levelledPara.title: Notation
levelledPara.para: The element <notation> represents a NOTATION declaration.

listItem.para: publicId, the optional PUBLIC ID of the notation.
systemId, the optional SYSTEM ID of the notation.

levelledPara.title: Media
levelledPara.para: The element <media> groups a set of alternative ICN formats for a particular output media type.

listItem.para: name, the identifier of the output media.

levelledPara.title: ICN
levelledPara.para: The element <icn> maps an ICN to a filename and optionally a notation. When this element occurs as a child of a <media> element, it will be used when that output media is specified with the -m option. When it occurs as a child of <icnCatalog>, it will be used if no media is specified.

listItem.para: uri, the filename the ICN will resolve to
notation, a reference to a previously declared <notation> element.

para.verbatimText: <icnCatalog> <notation name="jpg" systemId="jpg"/> <notation name="png" systemId="png"/> <notation name="svg" systemId="svg"/> <media name="pdf"> <icn infoEntityIdent="ICN-12345-00001-001-01" uri="ICN-12345-00001-001-01.JPG" notation="jpg"/> </media> <media name="web"> <icn infoEntityIdent="ICN-12345-00001-001-01" uri="ICN-12345-00001-001-01.SVG" notation="svg"/> </media> <icn infoEntityIdent="ICN-12345-00001-001-01" uri="ICN-12345-00001-001-01.PNG" notation="png"/> </icnCatalog>
